fields.title: Products  - Requirements link
fields.sql:
SELECT DISTINCT service.name AS "Service name",
				comp.name AS "Component name",
				pg.name AS "Product group",
				p.name AS "Product name",
                r.id AS "Requirement UID",
                r.name AS "Requirement name",
                d.name AS "Dissemination",
                qcp.name AS "Quality Control Procedure",
                rg.name AS "Requirement group",
                m_unc.goal || ' - ' || m_unc.threshold || ' - ' || m_unc.breakthrough AS "Uncertainty",
                m_upd.goal || ' - ' || m_upd.threshold || ' - ' || m_upd.breakthrough AS "Update Frequency",
                m_hori.goal || ' - ' || m_hori.threshold || ' - ' || m_hori.breakthrough AS "Horizontal Resolution",
                m_vert.goal || ' - ' || m_vert.threshold || ' - ' || m_vert.breakthrough AS "Vertical Resolution",
                dl.name AS "Level of definition",
                rel.name AS "Relevance",
                crit.name AS "Criticality",
                bar.name AS "Barriers",
                lc.name AS "Level of Compliance",
                r.state AS "State",
                a.first_name || ' ' || a.last_name AS "Owner",
                pr.note
FROM insitu_product p
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_productrequirement pr ON pr.product_id = p.id
AND p._deleted = FALSE
AND pr._deleted = FALSE
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_requirement r ON pr.requirement_id = r.id
AND r._deleted = FALSE
LEFT OUTER JOIN picklists_dissemination d ON d.id = r.dissemination_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN picklists_qualitycontrolprocedure qcp ON qcp.id = r.quality_control_procedure_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN picklists_requirementgroup rg ON rg.id = r.group_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_metric m_unc ON m_unc.id = r.uncertainty_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_metric m_upd ON m_upd.id = r.update_frequency_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_metric m_hori ON m_hori.id = r.horizontal_resolution_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_metric m_vert ON m_vert.id = r.vertical_resolution_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN picklists_definitionlevel dl ON dl.id = pr.level_of_definition_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN picklists_relevance rel ON rel.id = pr.relevance_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN picklists_criticality crit ON crit.id = pr.criticality_id
LEFT OUTER JOIN auth_user a ON r.created_by_id = a.id
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_productrequirement_barriers pr_bar ON pr_bar.productrequirement_id = pr.id
LEFT OUTER JOIN picklists_barrier bar ON bar.id = pr_bar.barrier_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_productgroup pg ON pg.id = p.group_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_component comp ON comp.id = p.component_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_copernicusservice service ON service.id = comp.service_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_datarequirement dr ON dr.requirement_id = r.id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_compliancelevel lc ON lc.id = dr.level_of_compliance_id
where (dr._deleted = FALSE
       OR dr._deleted IS NULL
       OR dr.id IS NULL)
GROUP BY p.name,
         r.id,
         r.name,
         d.name,
         qcp.name,
         rg.name,
         m_unc.goal,
         m_unc.threshold,
         m_unc.breakthrough,
         m_upd.goal,
         m_upd.threshold,
         m_upd.breakthrough,
         m_hori.goal,
         m_hori.threshold,
         m_hori.breakthrough,
         m_vert.goal,
         m_vert.threshold,
         m_vert.breakthrough,
         dl.name,
         rel.name,
         crit.name,
         r.state,
         a.first_name,
         a.last_name,
         pr.note,
         pg.name,
         comp.name,
         service.name,
         bar.name,
         lc.name
ORDER BY p.name
fields.description:
Use cases:
 1. List Requirements per given Product, Component, or Service
 2. List Requirements classified according to criticality per given Product, Component, or Service (filter by Criticality)
 3. List barriers per Product, Component, or Service
 4. List requirements with level_of_compliance different from “fully compliant” per given Service
5.  List main outstanding gaps per Service, Product, and Component ( by level of compliance)
6.  List  Requirements per given Product
7.  List Requirements with level_of_compliance “none” or “partially fullfilled” per given Service Component
8.  List Essential Requirements per given Product, Component, or Service (filter by Criticality)
9.  List Requirements per given Product, Component, or Service that are essential and not fulfilled (filter by Criticality and Level of Compliance)

fields.title: Products - Data  link
fields.sql:
SELECT service.name AS "Service name",
       comp.name AS "Component name",
       pg.name AS "Product group",
       p.id AS "Product UID",
       p.name AS "Product name",
       area.name AS "Product area",
       d.id AS "Data UID",
       d.name AS "Data name",
       area_data.name AS "Data area",
       dr.information_costs AS "Information costs",
       dr.handling_costs AS "Handling costs"
FROM insitu_product p
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_productrequirement pr ON pr.product_id = p.id
AND pr._deleted = FALSE
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_requirement r ON pr.requirement_id = r.id
AND r._deleted = FALSE
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_datarequirement dr ON dr.requirement_id = r.id
AND dr._deleted = FALSE
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_data d ON dr.data_id = d.id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_area area ON area.id = p.area_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_area area_data ON area_data.id = d.area_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_productgroup pg ON pg.id = p.group_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_component comp ON comp.id = p.component_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_copernicusservice service ON service.id = comp.service_id
WHERE p._deleted = FALSE
GROUP BY p.name,
         d.name,
         area.name,
         p.id,
         area_data.name,
         d.id,
         service.name,
         comp.name,
         pg.name,
         dr.information_costs,
         dr.handling_costs
ORDER BY p.name
fields.description:
Use cases:
1.  List Data  per given Product, Component, or Service
2.  List Data used by a given Product, Component, or Service. with (no) information/handling cost
3. Present a list of Data per Product group

fields.title: Products without data or requirement
fields.sql:
SELECT DISTINCT p.name AS "Product name",
                count(r.id) AS "Count of requirements",
                count(d.id) AS "Count of data"
FROM insitu_product p
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_productrequirement pr ON pr.product_id = p.id
AND pr._deleted = FALSE
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_requirement r ON pr.requirement_id = r.id
AND r._deleted = FALSE
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_datarequirement dr ON dr.requirement_id = r.id
AND dr._deleted = FALSE
LEFT OUTER JOIN insitu_data d ON dr.data_id = d.id
WHERE p._deleted = FALSE
GROUP BY p.name
HAVING count(r.id) = 0
OR count(d.id) = 0
ORDER BY p.name
fields.description:
Use cases:
 1. List Products without data and/or requirements.

fields.title: Entrusted entity component statistics
fields.sql:
SELECT DISTINCT e.name AS "Entrusted entity",
                c.name AS "Component",

  (SELECT count(r.id)
   FROM insitu_product p
   FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_productrequirement pr ON pr.product_id = p.id
   FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_requirement r ON pr.requirement_id = r.id
   WHERE p.component_id = c.id
     AND p._deleted = FALSE
     AND r._deleted = FALSE
     AND pr._deleted = FALSE) AS "Count requirements per component",

  (SELECT count(r.id)
   FROM insitu_entrustedentity ee
   FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_component cr ON ee.id = cr.entrusted_entity_id
   FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_product p ON p.component_id = cr.id
   FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_productrequirement pr ON pr.product_id = p.id
   FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_requirement r ON pr.requirement_id = r.id
   WHERE cr.entrusted_entity_id = e.id
     AND p._deleted = FALSE
     AND r._deleted = FALSE
     AND pr._deleted = FALSE) AS "Count requirements per entrusted entity"
FROM insitu_entrustedentity e
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_component c ON c.entrusted_entity_id = e.id
ORDER BY e.name
fields.description:
Use cases:
 1. Count Requirements per Entrusted Entity
 2. Count Requirements per Component

fields.title: Data provider statistics
fields.sql:
SELECT dp.name AS "Data provider",
       CASE
           WHEN dp.is_network = TRUE THEN 'Yes'
           ELSE 'No'
       END as "Is network",
       count(d.id) AS "Number of data delivered"
FROM insitu_dataprovider dp
INNER JOIN insitu_dataproviderrelation dpr ON dpr.provider_id = dp.id
INNER JOIN insitu_data d ON dpr.data_id = d.id
WHERE dp._deleted = FALSE
  AND dpr._deleted = FALSE
  AND d._deleted = FALSE
GROUP BY dp.name, dp.is_network
ORDER BY dp.name;
fields.description:
Use cases:
 1. List data providers which deliver data and a count of data delivered.

fields.title: Requirement Areas
fields.sql:
SELECT DISTINCT r.id AS "Requirement UID",
                r.name AS "Requirement name",
                a.name AS "Area"
FROM insitu_requirement r
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_productrequirement pr ON pr.requirement_id = r.id
AND pr._deleted = FALSE
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_product p ON pr.product_id = p.id
AND p._deleted = FALSE
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_area a ON p.area_id = a.id
WHERE r._deleted = FALSE
GROUP BY r.id,
         r.name,
         a.name
ORDER BY r.name;
fields.description:
Use cases:
1. List all requirements and their related areas.

fields.title: Data providers per countries
fields.sql:
SELECT dp.id AS "Data provider UID",
       dp.name AS "Data provider name",
       dp_network.name AS "Data provider network",
       pt.name AS "Provider type",
       c.name AS "Country"
FROM insitu_dataprovider dp
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_dataprovider_networks dpn ON dp.id = dpn.from_dataprovider_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_dataprovider dp_network ON dp_network.id = dpn.to_dataprovider_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_dataprovider_countries dpc ON dp.id = dpc.dataprovider_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_country c ON c.code = dpc.country_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_dataproviderdetails dpd ON dp.id = dpd.data_provider_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_providertype pt ON pt.id = dpd.provider_type_id
WHERE (dp._deleted = FALSE
       OR dp._deleted IS NULL
       OR dp.id IS NULL)
  AND (dp_network._deleted IS NULL
       OR dp_network.id IS NULL
       OR dp_network._deleted = FALSE)
  AND (dp_network.is_network = TRUE
       OR dp_network.is_network IS NULL)
  AND (dpd._deleted = FALSE
       OR dpd.id IS NULL)
ORDER BY dp.name
fields.description:
Use cases:
1.  List Data Providers for a given Country or Network
2.  List all commercial Data Providers for a given Country or Network (filter by provider type)

fields.title: Products - Data Providers link
fields.sql:
SELECT p.product_copernicus_service AS "Service name",
       p.product_entrusted_entity AS "Entrusted Entity",
       p.product_component AS "Component name",
       p.product_id AS "Product UID",
       p.product_name AS "Product name",
       p.product_area AS "Product area",
       pr.productrequirement_criticality AS "Criticality",
       pr.productrequirement_level_of_definition AS "Level of definition",
       pr.product_relevance AS "Relevance",
       r.requirement_id AS "Requirement UID",
       r.requirement_name AS "Requirement name",
       r.requirement_group AS "Requirement group",
       r.requirement_dissemination AS "Requirement Dissemination",
       r.requirement_update_frequency AS "Requirement Update Frequency",
       r.requirement_quality_control_procedure AS "Requirement Quality Control Procedure",
       r.requirement_timeliness AS "Requirement Timeliness",
       r.requirement_uncertainty AS "Requirement Uncertainty",
       r.requirement_horizontal_resolution AS "Requirement Horizontal Resolution",
       r.requirement_vertical_resolution AS "Requirement Vertical Resolution",
       r.requirement_owner AS "Requirement Owner",
       dr.datarequirement_information_costs AS "Information costs",
       dr.datarequirement_handling_costs AS "Handling costs",
       dr.datarequirement_level_of_compliance  AS "Level of compliance",
       d.data_id AS "Data UID",
       d.data_name AS "Data name",
       d.data_area AS "Data area",
       d.data_format AS "Data format",
       d.data_type AS "Data type",
       d.data_update_frequency AS "Data Update Frequency",
       d.data_policy AS "Data Policy",
       d.data_quality_control_procedure AS "Data Quality Control Procedure",
       d.data_timeliness AS "Data Timeliness",
       d.data_start_time_coverage AS "Start time coverage",
       d.data_end_time_coverage AS "End time coverage",
       d.data_dissemination AS "Dissemination",
       d.data_owner AS "Data owner",
       dp.data_provider_id AS "Data provider UID",
       dp.data_provider_name AS "Data provider name",
       dp.data_provider_type AS "Provider type"
FROM insitu_product_view p
INNER JOIN insitu_productrequirement_view pr ON p.product_id = pr.productrequirement_product_id
INNER JOIN insitu_requirement_view r ON r.requirement_id = pr.productrequirement_requirement_id
INNER JOIN insitu_datarequirement_view dr ON r.requirement_id = dr.datarequirement_requirement_id
INNER JOIN insitu_data_view d ON d.data_id = dr.datarequirement_data_id
INNER JOIN insitu_dataproviderrelation_view dpr ON d.data_id = dpr.dataproviderrelation_data_id
INNER JOIN insitu_dataprovider_view dp ON dp.data_provider_id = dpr.dataproviderrelation_provider_id
fields.description:
Use cases:
1. List Data Providers per given Product, Component, or Service
2. List all commercial Data Providers contributing to Copernicus per Service (filter by provider type)
3. List Data providers (networks) contributing to Copernicus per Entrusted Entity
4.  List of Service, Product and Component to which a selected Data provider contribute.
5.  List  Data Providers per Product, Component or Service
6.  List Networks and DataProviders delivering data to the selected service/entrusted Entities
7.  List Data Providers deliver essential data to us  (filter by Level of Compliance)

fields.title: Data  - Requirements compliance
fields.sql:
SELECT service.name AS "Service name",
       comp.name AS "Component name",
       p.id AS "Product UID",
       p.name AS "Product name",
       area.name AS "Product area",
       r.id AS "Requirement UID",
       r.name AS "Requirement name",
       d.id AS "Data UID",
       d.name AS "Data name",
       area_data.name AS "Data area",
       lc.name AS "Level of compliance"
FROM insitu_product p
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_productrequirement pr ON pr.product_id = p.id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_requirement r ON pr.requirement_id = r.id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_datarequirement dr ON dr.requirement_id = r.id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_data d ON dr.data_id = d.id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_compliancelevel lc ON lc.id = dr.level_of_compliance_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_component comp ON comp.id = p.component_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_copernicusservice service ON service.id = comp.service_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_area area ON area.id = p.area_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_area area_data ON area_data.id = d.area_id
WHERE (p._deleted = FALSE
       OR p._deleted IS NULL
       OR p.id IS NULL)
  AND (pr._deleted = FALSE
       OR pr._deleted IS NULL
       OR pr.id IS NULL)
  AND (r._deleted = FALSE
       OR r._deleted IS NULL
       OR r.id IS NULL)
  AND (dr._deleted = FALSE
       OR dr._deleted IS NULL
       OR dr.id IS NULL)
  AND (d._deleted = FALSE
       OR d._deleted IS NULL
       OR d.id IS NULL)
fields.description:
Use cases:
1.  List Data fully compliant with Requirements ( filter by Level of compliance)

fields.title: Data report
fields.sql:
SELECT d.id AS "Data UID",
	   d.name AS "Data name",
       d.note AS "Data note",
	   area_data.name AS "Data area",
       dformat.name AS "Data format",
       dp.name AS "Data policy",
       dt.name AS "Data type",
       timeliness.name AS "Timeliness",
       uf.name AS "Update frequency",
       qcp.name AS "Quality Control Procedure",
       dm.name AS "Dissemination",
       ev.domain AS "Essential variable domain",
       it.name AS "Inspire theme",
       d.start_time_coverage AS "Start time coverage",
       d.end_time_coverage AS "End time coverage",
       d.state AS "Data state"
FROM insitu_data d
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_area area_data ON area_data.id = d.area_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_dataformat dformat ON dformat.id = d.data_format_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_datapolicy dp ON dp.id = d.data_policy_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_datatype dt ON dt.id = d.data_type_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_timeliness timeliness ON timeliness.id = d.timeliness_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_updatefrequency uf ON uf.id = d.update_frequency_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_dissemination dm ON dm.id = d.dissemination_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_qualitycontrolprocedure qcp ON qcp.id = d.quality_control_procedure_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_data_essential_variables dev ON d.id = dev.data_id
FULL OUTER JOIN insitu_data_inspire_themes dit ON d.id = dit.data_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_essentialvariable ev ON ev.id = dev.essentialvariable_id
FULL OUTER JOIN picklists_inspiretheme it ON it.id = dit.inspiretheme_id
WHERE d._deleted = FALSE
fields.description:
Use cases:
1. List INSPIRE themes covered by Data
